text: Hi, we frequently create blog posts that include log file or code snippets. I'd like to have a scrollable (horizontally and vertically) or clickable box that displays the snippet. Any ideas? I am not a developer.
<@UHZ5JLAJY> We've used prism js for this before <https://prismjs.com/> was pretty easy to implement
you would def need to use source code view (under the advanced menu in the wysiwyg) to place the code correctly, but we its pretty useful
sample in action on our site: <https://www.wearediagram.com/blog/tutorial-time-build-an-episerver-featured-videos-block-using-youtube-data-api-v3>
Thanks <@U2H3TT8F2> this is exactly what I want. Hopefully I'll be able to figure out how to implement it :slightly_smiling_face:

FYI - looks like there are instructions on how to make it work with CMS here: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Blog-Website-Page-Publishing/Correctly-using-PrismJS-Syntax-Highlighter-for-HubSpot-Blog/td-p/263257>
